title: Open Chords
summary: Start strumming Em, G, C, D, and Am with clean tone.
keyPoints: Learn the shapes for Em, G, C, D, and Am
Use fingertips to keep open strings ringing
Strum through all strings needed for each chord
Keep your fretting hand relaxed and curved
Listen for muted strings and adjust slowly
Aim for smooth, steady chord changes
commonMistakes: Letting fingers collapse and mute open strings
Strumming strings that are not part of the chord
Rushing chord changes without clean placement
Pressing too hard and tiring the hand
practiceDrill: Strum Em slowly and check every string
Switch between Em and G four times
Switch between C and D four times
Cycle Am → C → D → G with slow downstrokes
Repeat the cycle with light upstrokes
